parsed.internal_thinking: After analyzing the board, Node 20 stands out as the strongest starting position for an expansion-heavy strategy. It provides high-probability access to Brick (6) and Sheep (8), along with Wood (11). In the early game, securing a 6-Brick is crucial because Brick is relatively scarce on this board (the other Brick hexes are 10s). Node 20 has a total of 12 pips, which is excellent. While Node 43 has 13 pips, it is entirely Wheat, which lacks the diversity needed for early growth. By taking Node 20, I secure the best Brick on the board and a very strong Sheep hex, setting myself up to build roads and settlements quickly. [Response was too brief]
parsed.note_to_self: I am prioritizing early game expansion by taking the best Brick/Sheep combo. I need to look for Ore and Wheat in my second placement to balance my economy for the late game.
parsed.say_outloud: hey everyone! let's get this started. i'll take the 6-8-11 spot, looks like a solid base for some early roads.
